comments:
I have tried debugging a very simple application with one breakpoint set, but 
the debugger failed to start. (I have tried Java 1.4.1 javaw and java as well)
The Debugger says Launching... and nothing happens.

Here is the log output
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 dec. 04, 2002 13:59:44.102
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI: 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Could not find a free socket for the 
debugger

(ModalContext.java:98)
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 4 118 dec. 04, 2002 13:59:44.132
!MESSAGE Could not find a free socket for the debugger

The debugger looks for a free socket by trying 10 random ports between port 
5000 and 15000.

But there is no port blocked between 5000 and 15000, so IMHO, it should start, 
but does not.

Are you using the latest version? (the bug states 2.0.2). Perhaps I could 
provide you with a version of the launching plugin that would log more 
information so we can see what is going on. (but this would be easiest if using 
the latest code base).

Created an attachment (id=2915)
Replacement plug-in for debugging

Attached is a zip file containing a replacement plug-in, to help debug the
problem. Replace your "org.eclipse.jdt.launching" plugin with the plug-in in
the zip, and then attempt to launch your program in debug mode. It will dump
messages to the console indcating which ports it is attempting to use, and what
IOExceptions are being generated.

I have downloaded the plugin replacement, however, I do not get anything 
printed to the console, and eclipse.log is also missing.

The output will be printed to the DOS console that appears when you start 
Eclipse (if there is one). You will need to start Eclipse with "java", rather 
than "javaw".

Trying port: 8826
java.net.SocketException: Malformed reply from SOCKS server

Context.java:98)

Does this appear 10 times for different sockets? (i.e. we try 10 different 
ports). This sounds like a problem with your TCP installation. Can you try on a 
different machine?

Yeah, I get the same message for all ports tried.
My TCP/IP is otherwise working OK.
I will try on some other machine on the weekend.
Tried. It worx. Sorry for the trouble, and thx for the help.
Thanks for the update. Marking as "works for me".
